Problem:
We consider a system where the current at any time t in an electrical circuit is determined by the integral transformation \\( I(t) = \\int_0^t e^{-(t - \\tau)}V(\\tau) d\\tau \\), where \\( V(t) \\) represents the voltage source function. We also consider a time-dependent change in resistance modeled by the function \\( R(t) = 1 + \\sin(\\omega t) \\) affecting the voltage source.

If a voltage source \\( V(t) = V_0 \\sin(\\omega t) \\) is applied and allowed to evolve under the existing integral transformation, will the output current \\( I(t) \\) at any moment t be solely dependent on the input \\( V(t) \\) without considering resistance changes?
Explanation: The presence of a time-dependent resistance, \\( R(t) \\), affects how voltage translates into current, making the output current \\( I(t) \\) dependent not just on the voltage source but also on how the resistance varies over time.
